text: Psalm 72
A Prayer for the Prosperity of God’s Anointed King
Of Solomon.\f + \fr Ps 72 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm \f*
O God, give your judgments to \add the\add* king,
and your righteousness to \add the\add* king’s son.
May he judge your people with righteousness,
and your poor with justice.
Let \add the\add* mountains yield prosperity\f + \fr 72:3 \ft Or “peace” \f* for the people,
and \add the\add* hills in righteousness.
May he provide justice \add for the\add* poor of \add the\add* people,
save \add the\add* children of \add the\add* needy,
and crush \add the\add* oppressor.

May he live long\f + \fr 72:5 \ft This presupposes the reading, suggested by the LXX, that might indicate that two of the Hebrew root letters have been inverted. The Hebrew reads “They will/Let them fear” \f* ⸤while the sun endures⸥\f + \fr 72:5 \ft Literally “with \fq the \ft sun” \f*
⸤as long as the moon⸥\f + \fr 72:5 \ft Literally “in the presence of the moon” \f* ⸤for all generations⸥.\f + \fr 72:5 \ft Literally “generation of generations” \f*
May he descend like rain on mown grass,
like showers watering \add the\add* earth.
May \add what is\add* right blossom in his days
and an abundance of peace, until \add the\add* moon is no more.
And may he rule from sea up to sea,
and from \add the\add* River\f + \fr 72:8 \ft That is, the Euphrates \f* to \add the\add* edges of \add the\add* land.
Let \add the\add* desert dwellers bow down before him,
and his enemies lick the dust.
Let the kings of Tarshish and \add the\add* islands bring tribute.
Let the kings of Sheba and Seba present gifts,
and let all kings bow down to him.
Let all nations serve him.
Indeed he will deliver \add the\add* needy \add who is\add* crying for help,
and \add the\add* afflicted \add who\add* has no helper.
He will take pity on \add the\add* helpless and needy,
and \add the\add* lives of \add the\add* needy he will save.
From oppression and from violence
he will redeem their lives,
and their blood will be precious in his eyes.
So may he live, and may gold from Sheba be given to him,
and may prayers be offered for him continually.
May blessings be invoked for him ⸤all day long⸥.\f + \fr 72:15 \ft Literally “all the day” \f*
May there be an abundance of grain in the land
\add even\add* on \add the\add* top of \add the\add* mountains.
May his crop\f + \fr 72:16 \ft Or “May his descendants” \f* sway like the \add trees of\add* Lebanon,
and may \add those\add* from \add the\add* city blossom like the grass of the earth.
May his name endure forever.
May his name increase ⸤as long as the sun shines⸥,\f + \fr 72:17 \ft Literally “\fq in the \ft presence of the sun” \f*
and let them be blessed in him.
Let all nations call him blessed.
Blessed be Yahweh God, the God of Israel,
\add who\add* alone does wonderful things.
And blessed be his glorious name forever,
and may the whole earth be filled with his glory.
Amen and Amen.
The prayers of David, the son of Jesse, are completed.
